title: How to Export Evernote to OneNote: Easy Migration Guide

steps.title: Export your Evernote data as an ENEX file.
steps.content: Export your Evernote data as an ENEX file. To use the Evernote2Onenote migration tool, you'll need to export all of your data from Evernote to an ENEX database file. [1] X Research source In Evernote, select the notebook you want to export. Right-click the notebook and select Export… Select the ENEX format. [2] X Research source Choose which attributes to include in your data. If you have duplicate tags, you may accidentally migrate duplicate notes. Make sure to clean up your tags before exporting them. Click Export . Save the file in a location you'll remember.

steps.title: Install the correct version of OneNote.
steps.content: Install the correct version of OneNote. If the version of OneNote you've installed came from the Microsoft Store, you won't be able to migrate to OneNote with this tool. To make sure you have the right version, follow these steps to install OneNote: Go to https://www.onenote.com and sign in with your Microsoft account . Click Download at the top and save the installer to your PC. Double-click OfficeSetup.exe and follow the on-screen instructions to install OneNote. Open OneNote and sign in if you haven't already.

steps.title: Download the Evernote2OneNote tool.
steps.content: Download the Evernote2OneNote tool. You can get it from the developer's GitHub repository at https://github.com/stefankueng/EvImSync/releases . To download the file, click Evernote2Onenote-1.3.6.zip . The number in the link will change as new versions are released.

steps.title: Unzip the downloaded file.
steps.content: Unzip the downloaded file. You won't need to install anything to use Evernote2Onenote, but you will need to unzip the file. Here's how: Right-click the downloaded ZIP file. Click Extract All . Select a location to extract the files to. Click Extract . A new window will appear containing the migration tool, which is called Evernote2Onenote.exe.

steps.title: Open the Evernote2Onenote tool.
steps.content: Open the Evernote2Onenote tool. To do so, double-click Evernote2Onenote.exe in the extracted folder.

steps.title: Select your migration preferences.
steps.content: Select your migration preferences. By default, the tool is set to migrate all Evernote notes newer than January 1, 1799. So, unless you don't want to import everything , you can leave the defaults in place. By default, "Use Modified-Date of notes in OneNote" is checked—if you leave this checked, the dates on your exported notes will be changed to today's date in OneNote. If you want to keep the original dates, uncheck the box.

steps.title: Click the Import ENEX file button.
steps.content: Click the Import ENEX file button. This opens a File Explorer window.

steps.title: Select the exported ENEX file from Evernote and click Open.
steps.content: Select the exported ENEX file from Evernote and click Open . This imports the selected notebook into OneNote. Depending on the size of your notebook, the migration may take several minutes. Repeat for each additional notebook you exported from Evernote. Once the migration is complete, you will find all migrated notes in OneNote.

steps.title: Download OneNote Batch for Mac.
steps.content: Download OneNote Batch for Mac. We haven't found a free Evernote to OneNote migration tool for macOS. However, OneNote Batch, a paid option, does work to export your Evernote notebooks to OneNote on a Mac. The tool costs $28 USD, but you can test it with a free demo before committing. [3] X Research source Here's how to get it: Go to https://www.onenotegem.com/a/addins/onenote-batch-for-mac.html . Click the Download button to save the file to your Mac's default download location. If you haven't yet installed OneNote , you will need to do that before you continue, and then log in with your Microsoft account .

steps.title: Install and open OneNote Batch.
steps.content: Install and open OneNote Batch. Depending on your settings, you may see some different options during this process. Here's what you'll need to do: Double-click the downloaded file (OneNoteBatch.pkg.zip) to unzip it . Double-click the extracted file (OneNoteBatch.pkg). If you see a pop-up asking if you want to open the app anyway, click Open to proceed. If you see a warning telling you the app cannot be installed because "macOS cannot verify that this app is free from malware," click OK to close the error. Then, click the Apple menu and go to System Settings > Privacy & Security , click Open Anyway , and click Open . OneNote Batch should now be open. Leave it open, as you'll need to come back to it in a few moments.

steps.title: Export your Evernote notebooks in the ENEX format.
steps.content: Export your Evernote notebooks in the ENEX format. The process is pretty simple: Select the notebook you want to export from Evernote. Control-click the notebook and select Export. Select ENEX format (.enex) as the file format. Choose which attributes to export, such as tags, dates, author, etc. [4] X Research source Click Export to save the exported notebook to your desktop.

steps.title: In OneNote Batch, click the Import tab.
steps.content: In OneNote Batch, click the Import tab. You'll see it at the top of the application. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Evernote icon.
steps.content: Click the Evernote icon. It's the elephant at the top of the window.

steps.title: Select where to import your notebook.
steps.content: Select where to import your notebook. In the left panel, you can select a section under "Evernote" to import the notebook to.

steps.title: Click the Play button.
steps.content: Click the Play button. It's the sideways triangle on the right side of the tool. A pop-up window will appear.

steps.title: Select the exported notebook and click Open.
steps.content: Select the exported notebook and click Open . This imports the notebook into OneNote. Once the notebooks are synced to OneNote, you'll find them in the new "Evernote" section.
